issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A couple of automated tests have been performed on this setup and then I started to use this machine and saw slowness (perhaps EUCA-10623). However then tried to restart the eucalyptus-cloud service and notice the following message,
{noformat}
[root@e-18 ~]# service eucalyptus-cloud restart
Stopping Eucalyptus services: done.
Starting Eucalyptus services: Warning: your database credentials have changed
Warning: most recent backup: //var/lib/eucalyptus/backups/keys/euca.p12.150407.1428414969
done.
{noformat}

And the cloud didn't start because it was failing because of the disabled.lock file.

{noformat}
# euca-describe-services

comments.body:
Installed Packages - version bump didn't happen yet for 4.2.0 (EUCA-10714)
{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.1
Release     : 0.0.23217.415.20150406git7fe88c1.el6
Size        : 307 k
Repo        : installed
{noformat}

[~shaon]

Can you provide steps to reproduce this issue?

I saw this issue once after setting up a cloud with above topologies via new QA system. I will try more setups with the same topology and try to reproduce the issue. The fundamental thing here can be distributed Java components.
